title: Meaning of x_1,x_2,...,x_n
text: The underscores of the $$x$$ denote the different components of $$x$$, which are multiplied by the coefficient vector using the dot product.

title: Dot Product
text: The dot product multiplies the corresponding components of the two vectors and adds them all together. For example, the first component of $$x$$ with the first component of the a vector.

title: Expanded Dot Product
text: When the a and the $$x$$ are dot product multiplied, the resulting expansion is in the form $$a_1 x_1+a_2 x_2+...+a_{nx,n}$$.

title: Value of Coefficient Vector
text: The components of the coefficient vector a correspond to the coefficients of the $$x$$ components. For example, the first component of the coefficient vector is the coefficient of $$x_1$$.

title: Components of $$x$$
text: Since there are $$n$$ number of $$x$$ terms in f(x), the corresponding vector goes up to $$n$$ components.
